snippet: A large armored contingent of Syria’s elite Republican Guard stormed a western Damascus suburb near the presidential palace on Friday, residents and antigovernment activists said.
abstract: Syria's elite Republican Guard storm rebel stronghold in western Damascus suburb near the presidential palace, bringing intense combat unusually close to Pres Bashar al-Assad's doorstep; fighting follows days of shelling by government forces after three-month truce collapses in area.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria; C. J. Chivers from the United States; Hwaida Saad and Hania Mourtada from Beirut; Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul; and Alan Cowell from Paris.

lead_paragraph: A large armored contingent of Syria’s elite Republican Guard stormed a western Damascus suburb near the presidential palace on Friday, residents and antigovernment activists said.

headline.main: Syrian Forces Attack Rebel Stronghold Near Palace
headline.print_headline: Syrian Forces Attack Rebel Stronghold Near Palace
